docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Jan. 25 (AP by mail) -- Threatened migration of 5,000 Mennonites from farms in the Chaco to new and warless fields in Uruguay or Brazil will be averted if any concessions which Paraguay can make will induce the sturdy colonists to...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Jan. 25 (AP by mail) -- Threatened migration of 5,000 Mennonites from farms in the Chaco to new and warless fields in Uruguay or Brazil will be averted if any concessions which Paraguay can make will induce the sturdy colonists to remain.

docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Feb. 13 -- The Paraguayan troops defending Fort Nanawa (Ayala) attached the trenches of the besieging Bolivians all along the line Saturday night, it was learned today, but were repulsed at every point.
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Feb. 13 -- The Paraguayan troops defending Fort Nanawa (Ayala) attached the trenches of the besieging Bolivians all along the line Saturday night, it was learned today, but were repulsed at every point.
docs.abstract: Paraguayans attack besieging Bolivians; Mennonite exodus feared

headline.main: PARAGUAY ATTACKS CHACO BESIEGERS; Iron Ring of Bolivians Beats Back Assault of Defenders at Fort Nanawa. COLONIST EXODUS FEARED Pacifistic Mennonites Look for a Peaceful Home Site In Brazil OP Northern Uruguay.

docs.snippet: NEW YORK. Mrs. Willard S. Brown will give a luncheon today at her home, 105 East Thirty-fifth Street, for the Hon. Moya Beresford, who returned yesterday from Palm Beach.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Feb. 15. -- Provision for invocation of the nine-power treaty guaranteeing the integrity of China is contained in the draft of the recommendation of the League of Nations on the Chino-Japanese situation. Also the way is paved for consultation...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Feb. 15. -- Provision for invocation of the nine-power treaty guaranteeing the integrity of China is contained in the draft of the recommendation of the League of Nations on the Chino-Japanese situation. Also the way is paved for consultation with the United States as soon as the report is adopted.
docs.abstract: League rept provides for invocation of 9-power treaty guaranteeing integrity of China and for consultation with U S

headline.main: FAR EAST REPORT BIDS FOR OUR AID; The League Recommendations Make Provision for Invoking Nine-Power Treaty. IDEA TO BAN FORCE GAINS Arms Parley Group Tacitly Agrees to Put the Declaration on a Universal Plane.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: THE recent opening of a radio telephone service between the United States and Colombia marks another link in the vast chain of communications emanating from this city. Residents of New York can now reach 33,500,000 individual telephones, or 92 per...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE recent opening of a radio telephone service between the United States and Colombia marks another link in the vast chain of communications emanating from this city. Residents of New York can now reach 33,500,000 individual telephones, or 92 per cent of all those in the world, located in forty-six countries.

headline.main: NEW YORK CAN NOW TALK WITH FORTY-FIVE COUNTRIES

docs.snippet: THE term North America -- to which the English imperialists take exception -- suggests a geographical entity, and also a distinct civilization, which embraces the Dominion of Canada and most of the United States.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: THE chief characteristic of a political regime in Latin America is the predominating part played by the President. During election campaigns it is not the balloting for the Assemblies which arouses interest. Attention is entirely and passionately...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE chief characteristic of a political regime in Latin America is the predominating part played by the President. During election campaigns it is not the balloting for the Assemblies which arouses interest. Attention is entirely and passionately concentrated on the designation of the President, who is not to preside but to govern

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA: HOTHOUSE OF DICTATORS; Andre Siegfried Sets Forth the Reasons Why Presidents Are Able to Rule Arbitrarily
